00037 #ifndef _LUSTRE_LU_TARGET_H
00038 #define _LUSTRE_LU_TARGET_H

00040 #include <dt_object.h>

00045 
00046 /* Each one represents a distribute transaction replay
00047  * operation, and updates on each MDTs are linked to
00048  * dtr_sub_list */
00049 struct distribute_txn_replay_req {
00050         /* update record, may be vmalloc'd */
00051         struct llog_update_record *dtrq_lur;
00052         int                     dtrq_lur_size;
00053 
00054         /* linked to the distribute transaction replay
00055          * list (tdtd_replay_list) */
00056         struct list_head        dtrq_list;
00057         __u64                   dtrq_master_transno;
00058         __u64                   dtrq_batchid;
00059         __u64                   dtrq_xid;
00060 
00061         /* all of sub updates are linked here */
00062         struct list_head        dtrq_sub_list;
00063         spinlock_t              dtrq_sub_list_lock;
00064 
00065         /* If the local update has been executed during replay */
00066         __u32                   dtrq_local_update_executed:1;
00067 };
00068 
00069 /* Each one represents a sub replay item under a distribute
00070  * transaction. A distribute transaction will be operated in
00071  * two or more MDTs, and updates on each MDT will be represented
00072  * by this structure */
00073 struct distribute_txn_replay_req_sub {
00074         __u32                   dtrqs_mdt_index;
00075 
00076         /* All of cookies for the update will be linked here */
00077         spinlock_t              dtrqs_cookie_list_lock;
00078         struct list_head        dtrqs_cookie_list;
00079         struct list_head        dtrqs_list;
00080 };
00081 
00082 struct target_distribute_txn_data;
00083 typedef int (*distribute_txn_replay_handler_t)(struct lu_env *env,
00084                                        struct target_distribute_txn_data *tdtd,
00085                                        struct distribute_txn_replay_req *dtrq);
00086 struct target_distribute_txn_data {
00087         /* Distribution ID is used to identify updates log on different
00088          * MDTs for one operation */
00089         spinlock_t              tdtd_batchid_lock;
00090         __u64                   tdtd_batchid;
00091         struct lu_target        *tdtd_lut;
00092         struct dt_object        *tdtd_batchid_obj;
00093         struct dt_device        *tdtd_dt;
00094 
00095         /* Committed batchid for distribute transaction */
00096         __u64                   tdtd_committed_batchid;
00097 
00098         /* List for distribute transaction */
00099         struct list_head        tdtd_list;
00100 
00101         /* Threads to manage distribute transaction */
00102         wait_queue_head_t       tdtd_commit_thread_waitq;
00103         atomic_t                tdtd_refcount;
00104 
00105         /* recovery update */
00106         distribute_txn_replay_handler_t tdtd_replay_handler;
00107         struct list_head                tdtd_replay_list;
00108         struct list_head                tdtd_replay_finish_list;
00109         spinlock_t                      tdtd_replay_list_lock;
00110         /* last replay update transno */
00111         __u32                           tdtd_replay_ready:1;
00112 
00113         /* Manage the llog recovery threads */
00114         atomic_t                tdtd_recovery_threads_count;
00115         wait_queue_head_t       tdtd_recovery_threads_waitq;
00116 };
00117 
00118 struct lu_target {
00119         struct obd_device       *lut_obd;
00120         struct dt_device        *lut_bottom;
00121 
00122         struct target_distribute_txn_data *lut_tdtd;
00123         struct ptlrpc_thread    lut_tdtd_commit_thread;
00124 
00125         /* supported opcodes and handlers for this target */
00126         struct tgt_opc_slice    *lut_slice;
00127         __u32                    lut_reply_fail_id;
00128         __u32                    lut_request_fail_id;
00129 
00130         /* sptlrpc rules */
00131         rwlock_t                 lut_sptlrpc_lock;
00132         struct sptlrpc_rule_set  lut_sptlrpc_rset;
00133         spinlock_t               lut_flags_lock;
00134         int                      lut_sec_level;
00135         unsigned int             lut_syncjournal:1,
00136                                  lut_sync_lock_cancel:2,
00137                                  /* e.g. OST node */
00138                                  lut_no_reconstruct:1;
00140         struct dt_object        *lut_last_rcvd;
00141         /* transaction callbacks */
00142         struct dt_txn_callback   lut_txn_cb;
00144         struct lr_server_data    lut_lsd;
00146         __u64                    lut_last_transno;
00148         spinlock_t               lut_translock;
00150         spinlock_t               lut_client_bitmap_lock;
00152         unsigned long           *lut_client_bitmap;
00153         /* Number of clients supporting multiple modify RPCs
00154          * recorded in the bitmap */
00155         atomic_t                 lut_num_clients;
00156         /* Client generation to identify client slot reuse */
00157         atomic_t                 lut_client_generation;
00159         struct dt_object        *lut_reply_data;
00161         unsigned long           **lut_reply_bitmap;
00163         atomic_t                 lut_sync_count;
00164 };
00165 
00166 /* number of slots in reply bitmap */
00167 #define LUT_REPLY_SLOTS_PER_CHUNK (1<<20)
00168 #define LUT_REPLY_SLOTS_MAX_CHUNKS 16

00173 struct tg_reply_data {
00175         struct list_head        trd_list;
00177         struct lsd_reply_data   trd_reply;
00179         __u64                   trd_pre_versions[4];
00181         int                     trd_index;
00183         __u16                   trd_tag;
00184 };

00186 extern struct lu_context_key tgt_session_key;
00187 
00188 struct tgt_session_info {
00189         /*
00190          * The following members will be filled explicitly
00191          * with specific data in tgt_ses_init().
00192          */
00193         struct req_capsule      *tsi_pill;
00194 
00195         /*
00196          * Lock request for "habeo clavis" operations.
00197          */
00198         struct ldlm_request     *tsi_dlm_req;
00199 
00200         /* although we have export in req, there are cases when it is not
00201          * available, e.g. closing files upon export destroy */
00202         struct obd_export       *tsi_exp;
00203         const struct lu_env     *tsi_env;
00204         struct lu_target        *tsi_tgt;
00205 
00206         const struct mdt_body   *tsi_mdt_body;
00207         struct ost_body         *tsi_ost_body;
00208         struct lu_object        *tsi_corpus;
00209 
00210         struct lu_fid            tsi_fid;
00211         struct ldlm_res_id       tsi_resid;
00212 
00213         /* object affected by VBR, for last_rcvd_update */
00214         struct dt_object        *tsi_vbr_obj;
00215         /* opdata for mdt_reint_open(), has the same value as
00216          * ldlm_reply:lock_policy_res1.  The tgt_update_last_rcvd() stores
00217          * this value onto disk for recovery when tgt_txn_stop_cb() is called.
00218          */
00219         __u64                    tsi_opdata;
00220 
00221         /*
00222          * Additional fail id that can be set by handler.
00223          */
00224         int                      tsi_reply_fail_id;
00225         bool                     tsi_preprocessed;
00226         /* request JobID */
00227         char                    *tsi_jobid;
00228 
00229         /* update replay */
00230         __u64                   tsi_xid;
00231         __u32                   tsi_result;
00232         __u32                   tsi_client_gen;
00233 };
00234 
00235 static inline struct tgt_session_info *tgt_ses_info(const struct lu_env *env)
00236 {
00237         struct tgt_session_info *tsi;
00238 
00239         LASSERT(env->le_ses != NULL);
00240         tsi = lu_context_key_get(env->le_ses, &tgt_session_key);
00241         LASSERT(tsi);
00242         return tsi;
00243 }
00244 
00245 static inline void tgt_vbr_obj_set(const struct lu_env *env,
00246                                    struct dt_object *obj)
00247 {
00248         struct tgt_session_info *tsi;
00249 
00250         if (env->le_ses != NULL) {
00251                 tsi = tgt_ses_info(env);
00252                 tsi->tsi_vbr_obj = obj;
00253         }
00254 }
00255 
00256 static inline void tgt_opdata_set(const struct lu_env *env, __u64 flags)
00257 {
00258         struct tgt_session_info *tsi;
00259 
00260         if (env->le_ses != NULL) {
00261                 tsi = tgt_ses_info(env);
00262                 tsi->tsi_opdata |= flags;
00263         }
00264 }
00265 
00266 static inline void tgt_opdata_clear(const struct lu_env *env, __u64 flags)
00267 {
00268         struct tgt_session_info *tsi;
00269 
00270         if (env->le_ses != NULL) {
00271                 tsi = tgt_ses_info(env);
00272                 tsi->tsi_opdata &= ~flags;
00273         }
00274 }
00275 
00276 /*
00277  * Generic unified target support.
00278  */
00279 enum tgt_handler_flags {
00280         /*
00281          * struct *_body is passed in the incoming message, and object
00282          * identified by this fid exists on disk.
00283          *                            *
00284          * "habeo corpus" == "I have a body"
00285          */
00286         HABEO_CORPUS = (1 << 0),
00287         /*
00288          * struct ldlm_request is passed in the incoming message.
00289          *
00290          * "habeo clavis" == "I have a key"
00291          *                                     */
00292         HABEO_CLAVIS = (1 << 1),
00293         /*
00294          * this request has fixed reply format, so that reply message can be
00295          * packed by generic code.
00296          *
00297          * "habeo refero" == "I have a reply"
00298          */
00299         HABEO_REFERO = (1 << 2),
00300         /*
00301          * this request will modify something, so check whether the file system
00302          * is readonly or not, then return -EROFS to client asap if necessary.
00303          *
00304          * "mutabor" == "I shall modify"
00305          */
00306         MUTABOR      = (1 << 3)
00307 };
00308 
00309 struct tgt_handler {
00310         /* The name of this handler. */
00311         const char              *th_name;
00312         /* Fail id, check at the beginning */
00313         int                      th_fail_id;
00314         /* Operation code */
00315         __u32                    th_opc;
00316         /* Flags in enum tgt_handler_flags */
00317         __u32                    th_flags;
00318         /* Request version for this opcode */
00319         int                      th_version;
00320         /* Handler function */
00321         int                     (*th_act)(struct tgt_session_info *tsi);
00322         /* Handler function for high priority requests */
00323         void                    (*th_hp)(struct tgt_session_info *tsi);
00324         /* Request format for this request */
00325         const struct req_format *th_fmt;
00326 };
00327 
00328 struct tgt_opc_slice {
00329         __u32                    tos_opc_start; /* First op code */
00330         __u32                    tos_opc_end; /* Last op code */
00331         struct tgt_handler      *tos_hs; /* Registered handler */
00332 };
00333 
00334 static inline struct ptlrpc_request *tgt_ses_req(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00335 {
00336         return tsi->tsi_pill ? tsi->tsi_pill->rc_req : NULL;
00337 }
00338 
00339 static inline __u64 tgt_conn_flags(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00340 {
00341         LASSERT(tsi->tsi_exp);
00342         return exp_connect_flags(tsi->tsi_exp);
00343 }
00344 
00345 static inline int req_is_replay(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00346 {
00347         LASSERT(req->rq_reqmsg);
00348         return !!(lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_REPLAY);
00349 }
00350 
00351 static inline bool tgt_is_multimodrpcs_client(struct obd_export *exp)
00352 {
00353         return exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_MULTIMODRPCS;
00354 }

00493 bool is_req_replayed_by_update(struct ptlrpc_request *req);
00494 enum {
00495         ESERIOUS = 0x0001000
00496 };
00497 
00498 static inline int err_serious(int rc)
00499 {
00500         LASSERT(rc < 0);
00501         return -(-rc | ESERIOUS);
00502 }
00503 
00504 static inline int clear_serious(int rc)
00505 {
00506         if (rc < 0)
00507                 rc = -(-rc & ~ESERIOUS);
00508         return rc;
00509 }
00510 
00511 static inline int is_serious(int rc)
00512 {
00513         return (rc < 0 && -rc & ESERIOUS);
00514 }
00515 
00519 static inline void tgt_drop_id(struct obd_export *exp, struct obdo *oa)
00520 {
00521         if (unlikely(exp_connect_rmtclient(exp))) {
00522                 oa->o_uid = -1;
00523                 oa->o_gid = -1;
00524                 oa->o_valid &= ~(OBD_MD_FLUID | OBD_MD_FLGID);
00525         }
00526 }
00527 
00528 /*
00529  * Unified target generic handers macros and generic functions.
00530  */
00531 #define TGT_RPC_HANDLER_HP(base, flags, opc, fn, hp, fmt, version)      \
00532 [opc - base] = {                                                        \
00533         .th_name        = #opc,                                         \
00534         .th_fail_id     = OBD_FAIL_ ## opc ## _NET,                     \
00535         .th_opc         = opc,                                          \
00536         .th_flags       = flags,                                        \
00537         .th_act         = fn,                                           \
00538         .th_fmt         = fmt,                                          \
00539         .th_version     = version,                                      \
00540         .th_hp          = hp,                                           \
00541 }
00542 #define TGT_RPC_HANDLER(base, flags, opc, fn, fmt, version)             \
00543         TGT_RPC_HANDLER_HP(base, flags, opc, fn, NULL, fmt, version)
00544 
00545 /* MDT Request with a format known in advance */
00546 #define TGT_MDT_HDL(flags, name, fn)                                    \
00547         TGT_RPC_HANDLER(MDS_FIRST_OPC, flags, name, fn, &RQF_ ## name,  \
00548                         LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION)
00549 /* Request with a format we do not yet know */

00552                         LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION)
